Dr Luke is demanding Kesha’s medical records be made available as part of the lawsuit against him.

In 2014 Kesha brought a case against the music producer for sexual assault and battery. Dr Luke is now requesting her medical records be turned over to the court as part of his countersuit to disprove her claims he sexually attacked her.

He’s filed a countersuit, claiming that he ‘never had sex with her’ and ‘did not rape her’, and says that the medical records could prove as such stating that she has waived any right to keep them private by making the allegations.

Rapper Azealia Banks is now claiming she is being ‘victimised’ by Twitter after they suspended her account.

Banks’ Twitter was taken off her after she launched a vicious attack on ex-One Direction member Zayn Malik and Disney Channel star Skai Jackson.

The move led Twitter users to mark the occasion with the hashtag #AzealiaGotSuspendedParty, and essentially still keeping her name in the headlines.

Azealia Banks’ Twitter account has finally been taken off her.

Twitter have swooped in and suspended the rapper from using the social media service.

Banks made headlines after she launched a verbal tirade at the former One Direction star, calling him ‘Punjab’ and a ‘sand n****r’.

Her account now shows a message from Twitter saying that the account has been taken down.

Twitter has suspended Azealia Banks account. pic.twitter.com/kbgGI1w8fE

— Karen Civil (@KarenCivil) May 12, 2016

On Wednesday night the rapper deleted almost her entire timeline, leaving just a handful of tweets.

Woody Allen has banned The Hollywood Reporter from a Cannes event for publishing sex abuse allegations.

The director’s publicist is said to have made the decision after the publication ran a guest column written by his son Ronan Farrow.

In it, Farrow alleged that Allen got into bed with his sister when she was 5-years-old and ‘forced her to suck his thumb’.

Now he has apparently blocked THR from attending an event at the film festival, which kicked off on Wednesday.

Senior editor at Fortune Pamela Kruger revealed the news on Twitter:

Robbie Williams is in a row with his neighbours over the always problematic issue of a new fence.

The former Take That singer is looking to build a barrier along the driveway of his £9 million home in Wiltshire, but has been hastily stopped by his local parish council who have objected to the plans.

They’ve said Robbie’s new fence would ‘adversely affect the visual amenity’ of Compton Bassett church, which is across the road.

Billie Piper has been granted a quickie divorce from her actor husband Laurence Fox, with the ruling lasting just 50 seconds.

Angelina Jolie has enrolled 12 Cambodian children into school and is paying for their education.

The 40-year-old actress ‘adopted’ a family of Cambodian children after her own children built up a friendship with Leida Shoun, aged 16, and her siblings, during the shooting of her latest film, First They Killed My Father.

Jolie and husband Brad Pitt’s connection to the family began last year, after Angelina’s children were approached by the young Cambodians when they were asking for dollars in their hometown of Siem Reap.

Just when you thought the Kardashians and Rob’s baby mama were getting on, Blac Chyna goes and throws a curve ball.

The 28-year-old announced her new emojis, called Chymojis (hmm where’ve we heard something similar before?), on Instagram – even using one to post about her pregnancy – and it turns out the set contains a rather peculiar image.

She has created a ‘slap’ emoji, where a large-pouted girl gets violently walloped around the chops. Except the girl bears a pretty striking resemblance to Blac’s sister-in-law, Kylie Jenner.

See the likeness? Has Blac just stirred up beef again?

Sheridan Smith has been signed off work for up to four weeks with ‘stress and exhaustion’.

The BAFTA-nominated actress has taken the last three days off from her West End production of Funny Girl and now producers of the show have released a statement on Twitter to reveal that Sheridan will ‘take 2 – 4 weeks leave of absence from the production due to stress and exhaustion.’

The pair are rumoured to have split before the Met Ball last week, which explains why they didn’t walk the red carpet together.

TMZ reports that Kylie was angry that Tyga attended the ball after their break up as he was reportedly only invited because of her.

The former Take That star’s wife Ayda Field has been accused by one time assistant Gilles De Bonfilhs of sexual harassment, making inappropriate comments, and talking about her own sex life.

Robbie has been attempting to quash the case but LA Superior Court Judge Deidre Hill is now encouraging the parties to settle out of court.

Kim Kardashian says she would be lending her brains to solving serious crime if she weren’t a reality TV star.

The 35-year-old Keeping Up With The Kardashians star says she would apply science to solve crimes and be ‘normal’.

Asked by Australian Vogue what she would do if she wasn’t famous, Kimmy quipped: ‘I would be a forensic investigator and live a normal life.’

Gareth Gates has made drinking a cup of tea sound like a lot of hard work – as this has become his new profession.

The former Pop Idol star has given up on his record making dreams and is now making ‘coconut infusion’ teas for a living.

Cuppanut (everyone loves a pun, Gareth) are available in three flavours (coconut, coconut and cranberry, and coconut, ginger and turmeric) while the teabags are biodegradable and contain ‘real coconut’.

Some good reading of the health benefits of coconut superhumancoach.com/benefits-of-co… then visit cuppanut.com to enjoy these benefits!

Azealia Banks has fired back at Zayn Malik and Skai Jackson after deleting her entire Twitter timeline.

Her timeline now only contains five tweets, starting with a video containing the message: ‘I love to disturb people because only by disturbing them I can make them think.’

The controversial rapper made headlines on Wednesday after she launched a racist tirade at Malik on social media, calling him ‘Punjab’.

Taylor Swift will be glad she was out scooping an award – as she avoided the scary moment of someone trying to break into her house.

The 26-year-old Wildest Dreams singer avoided a bit of a nightmare on Tuesday when a would-be intruder was apprehended outside her New York apartment.

Security for the pop star swooped into action, apprehending the man who was later described by law enforcement officials as ‘emotionally disturbed’ and held him until police and fire department officers arrived to cart him away.

Rachel Roy appears to be continuing to milk the controversy surrounding herself, Jay Z, Beyonce, and the ever elusive ‘Becky with the good hair’.

The 42-year-old fashion designer was set upon by fans who were convinced Rachel was the mysterious ‘Becky’ referenced in Beyonce’s new track Sorry – which details someone seemingly coming between the singer and her husband, Jay Z.

Yes Justin was casually pounding the pavement barefoot, feeding squirrels and loving life.

Holly Willoughby was left speechless on This Morning on Wednesday when she spoke to a young woman whose half- brother had posted pictures of her to an adult website.

Charley Hough told the ITV morning show that her brother, Olly Whiting, had ‘always been really kind and loving’.

‘I didn’t believe quite at first. I thought it had been blown out of proportion.’

The photos were taken from Facebook, and Phillip Schofield took control of the conversation, asking the three girls who were all affected what had happened and how it made them feel, as Holly sat there in shocked silence.
